We were thankful to find this two bedroom, one bath home in Plainview.
Definitely better than staying in a hotel room.
The house was quite clean, which we appreciated very much.
Everything we needed was provided, just took a little searching sometimes.
The Wi-Fi worked well and the workspace was handy.
Shelby had alerted us a couple of days ahead of time that her current refrigerator had stopped working, so we really appreciated the effort she made to get a brand new refrigerator set up before we arrived.
As others have commented, while we felt comfortable staying in Shelby’s home, it was a little awkward being there with all of her personal belongings in the house.
We made Shelby aware of a few issues with ceiling fixtures, but were able to work around them.
Sadly, we never were able to unlock the back door so we could enjoy the patio and yard. The afternoon prior to our departure, a friend of Shelby’s came by to help with the ceiling fixtures and explained that Shelby has been waiting for a replacement back door and we could have accessed the backyard by going through the garage and utility room.
The location was excellent and provided easy access to all of the events we attended in Plainview.
Overall, we enjoyed our stay.
